title: Developer-focused email platform Resend raises $3M
originSummary: Resend, a developer-focused email platform, has secured $3M in seed funding following its involvement in the Y Combinator Winter ’23 batch.

The platform offers an API for developers to integrate email features into their applications, bolstered by its React Email open-source project for consistent email presentation across different platforms.
Despite challenges from malevolent users intending to send spam or phishing emails, Resend employs an internal tool nicknamed "Robocop" designed to identify and counter such actions.

title: How to Send Emails with React Using Resend — SitePoint
originSummary: The article offers an in-depth tutorial on setting up emails with React using Resend and explains how to create an email component via React Email.
It outlines the process of obtaining an API key from Resend, verifying a domain, and building a contact form using Next.js.

The author, Rayan Kazi, stresses that while the setup for sending emails in React used to be challenging, the introduction of both React Email and Resend, made by the same development team, has significantly simplified this task.

title: Resend Email Package for Laravel and PHP
originSummary: Paul Redmond introduces a new package for Laravel and PHP, facilitating Resend API integration with mailers and enabling developers to send emails conveniently.
The Laravel version permits users to directly email through the API or integrate it as a mailer, implying flexibility in use.

An illustrative repository for Laravel and a vanilla PHP example are provided, along with extensive documentation for Resend installation in Laravel, assisting developers in understanding and implementing the package.
commentSummary: Gartner forecasts global IT expenditure to hit $4.1 trillion in 2021, marking an 8.4% increase from 2020.
The highest growth is predicted in enterprise software, including collaboration and remote working tools, and devices like laptops and tablets.
Though the pandemic has accelerated digital transformation initiatives, overall spending levels are not expected to return to 2019 amounts until 2022.

title: Modifying requests in Burp Proxy
originSummary: The article covers the wide range of editions available in Burp Suite, aimed at web vulnerability scanning, including Enterprise, Professional, Community, and Free versions.
It outlines an array of services provided by Burp Suite such as application security testing, automated scanning, bug bounty hunting, compliance checks, and penetration testing.
The article also provides a detailed tutorial on using Burp Proxy to modify an intercepted request, demonstrating the exploitation of a vulnerability in a fake online shopping setup.
commentSummary: The article explores how advanced technology is revolutionizing the space mining industry, with the possibility of extracting raw materials from extraterrestrial bodies such as asteroids and the Moon within the next 10-20 years.
Despite growing investments, the industry still grapples with cost, durability of equipment, and regulatory uncertainties.
Many believe that the development of space mining is essential for supporting future space missions and potential off-Earth colonies.

title: Sending emails with Edge Functions on Supabase
originSummary: The article serves as a tutorial on creating an edge function for email sending with Supabase, requiring foundational JavaScript knowledge.

The piece covers several topics including, the definition of edge functions (server-side TypeScript functions globally distributed for tasks like webhook listening and integration with third-party platforms), initializing Supabase locally, creating an edge function, setting environment variables, and functional deployment.
The author anticipates explaining in future tutorials how to trigger email notifications using these edge functions.
commentSummary: The article highlights the launch of Wheely, a luxury chauffeur service, in London amidst uncertainty over Uber's legal status in the city.
Wheely, which was first established in Moscow in 2012, offers chauffeur-driven deliveries of goods and shopping.
The service also plans to provide Rolls-Royce cars for transportation purposes, thereby differentiating itself with a touch of luxury.

title: Working with HTTP messages in Burp Repeater
originSummary: The Burp Suite is a web application security testing tool, featuring editions for dynamic web vulnerability scanning (Enterprise), web penetration testing (Professional), and initial web security testing (Community).

The tool includes functionalities such as Dastardly for lightweight scanning in CI/CD environments, DevSecOps, Automated Scanning, Bug Bounty Hunting, and Compliance, as well as the Burp Repeater feature for HTTP requests manipulation.

The document offers a user guide for the HTTP Repeater function, and discusses the vulnerabilities it can detect, different editions' features, and provides the contact details of PortSwigger Ltd, the tool's developer.

title: 10 Key Differences Between Stateful and Stateless
originSummary: The article elaborates on the differences and comparisons between stateful and stateless protocols critical for data processing and information exchange online.

Stateful protocols remember past transactions enhancing future transactions' security and information at a higher memory and server capacity expense. Stateless protocols, however, are resilient, scalable, and resource-efficient, albeit slower due to repetitive data transmission and lack of information storage.

Both protocols have unique attributes: stateful protocols offer superior transaction control but demand more processing power and storage, whereas stateless protocols are simpler, faster, and less reliant on client-server relations but have inferior record-keeping capability.
commentSummary: Swiss corporation Nestle is considerably expanding its research and development team in China, investing $50.8m to better suit the preferences of the Chinese market.
Along with modifying its products to match Chinese tastes, the strengthened team will also focus on developing healthier products.
Despite political antagonism between China and the West, Nestle views the Asian market as a crucial component of its future business strategy.

title: How to Build an OTP Verification System Using Python
originSummary: The guide instructs on building a one-time password (OTP) verification system using Python, where after three incorrect entries, the account gets locked.
It utilizes modules like Tkinter, Twilio, and Random, with the Twilio API and a phone number being vital for sending OTP requests.

The guide, written by software engineer Sai Ashish, also explores other Twilio applications with Python such as an SMS notification system for IoT devices and secure login systems, while cautioning users about Twilio API's pricing structure.

title: How to send WhatsApp messages to unsaved contacts
originSummary: Android Police shares techniques to send WhatsApp messages to numbers not saved in your contact list, either by adjusting WhatsApp's custom wa.me links or using third-party apps like WhtzDirect and Click to Chat.
Both methods eliminate the need for the recipient's number to be saved in the user's contact list.
Despite being available for iOS and Android devices, this functionality does not extend to WhatsApp group chats.

title: How to Send Email with the Gmail API and Node.js - Digital Inspiration
originSummary: The article provides a tutorial on using the Gmail API in conjunction with Node.js and Nodemailer to send emails from a Gmail or Google Workspace account.
Gmail API limits include sending up to 2,000 messages and reaching up to 10,000 recipients per day.

The tutorial details how to create a Google Cloud Project, enable Google APIs, set up Gmail OAuth Client, obtain the authorization code, generate an access token, and establish an Email Sender Library using Nodemailer.
commentSummary: The Li-Fi R&D Centre at the University of Edinburgh introduced Li-Fi technology that uses light to transmit data promising faster and stronger internet connectivity in urban environments.
Compared to traditional Wi-Fi, Li-Fi is potentially more reliable as it's unaffected by external interference typical for radio wave-based systems.
One drawback of Li-Fi technology is that it needs a direct line of sight and cannot penetrate walls like conventional Wi-Fi does.
